title: How to Put a Cover Photo on a Music File Using Windows Media Player

steps.title: Open Windows Media Player.
steps.content: Open Windows Media Player. This program comes with Windows devices. To find it, click the Start menu and type "windows media player". Click the first result. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source On Windows 11, this will look like Windows Media Player Legacy . Windows Media Player can also be used to copy or burn CDs , play DVDs , and more.

steps.title: Add the music file.
steps.content: Add the music file. If you don't see your music file in the library, click the Music tab on the left, and then drag and drop the MP3 file into the Windows Media Player window. Windows Media Player should automatically add the song's cover art. If you don't see it, or if you want to add your own cover art, proceed to the next step.

steps.title: Right-click the song.
steps.content: Right-click the song. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Find album info.
steps.content: Click Find album info . A new window will open. You'll see the song's album(s) on the right side.

steps.title: Select the correct album and click Finish.
steps.content: Select the correct album and click Finish . This will apply the album art for the selected album.

steps.title: Import your own image (optional).
steps.content: Import your own image (optional). If you'd rather use your own image as the cover art, do the following: Click the Music tab. Pause the song or album if it's currently playing. Drag and drop the new image onto the existing image.
